intro: Tephrosia kalamboensis, commonly known as the Kalambo tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are compound and pinnate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia kalamboensis produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in certain regions.
